file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 25-12-01-04 - CEILING LINING - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL CEILING LINING - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove/install the RH/LH ceiling-lining panels, center ceiling- lining panel, windshield upper lining and windshield center fairing. B. The RH/LH ceiling-lining panels, center ceiling-lining panel, windshield upper lining and windshield center fairing are installed in the cockpit, at zones 225 and 226. C. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ALL 25-12-01-000-801-A COCKPIT LINING - REMOVAL ALL 25-12-01-400-801-A COCKPIT LINING - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 25-12-01 Page 1 of 14 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 25-12-01-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. COCKPIT LINING - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to remove the cockpit lining. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 21-20-04-000-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 21-20-04-000-802-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-12-09-000-801-A/400 LH/RH COCKPIT LINING - REMOVAL AMM TASK 33-11-02-000-801-A/400 DOME LIGHT REFLECTOR - REMOVAL AMM TASK 33-11-04-000-801-A/400 READING LIGHT MOUNTING BASE - REMOVAL AMM TASK 33-11-04-000-802-A/400 READING LIGHT ASSEMBLY - REMOVAL AMM TASK 34-23-04-000-801-A/400 HGS COMBINER - REMOVAL C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 A - Does the task Cockpit 1 B - Helps the technician A Cockpit I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Make sure that the aircraft is safe for maintenance. (2) On the overhead panel, set the EMERG LT switch to OFF position and attach a DO- NOT-MOVE-FROM-OFF tag to it. (3) Make sure the DOME switch on the overhead panel is in the OFF position. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 25-12-01 Page 2 of 14 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (4) On the air CONDITIONING/PNEUMATIC control panel, on the overhead panel, make sure that PACK 1, PACK 2 and RECIRC switches are OFF, the lights will illuminate. (5) On the circuit breaker panel, open the COCKPIT READING lights circuit breaker and attach a DO-NOT-CLOSE tag to it. (6) Set the PILOT AND COPILOT rotatory switch on the glareshield panel to the OFF position. J. RH/LH Ceiling-Lining Panels - Removal (Figure 401) (Figure 402) (Figure 403) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) For aircraft without head up display, remove the screws (23) and washers (22) that attach the monorail. Refer to DET. C, Figure 401, sheet 2. (2) For aircraft with head up display, remove the screws (18) and washers (19) that attach the LH and RH monorail. Refer to DET. B, Figure 402, sheet 1. (3) Remove the screws (1) and washers (2) that attach the protection lining (3). Refer to DET. B, Figure 403. (4) Disconnect the electrical connector (5) from the temperature sensor (4). Refer to DET. B, Figure 403. (5) Remove the RH ceiling-lining panel (2) as follows. Refer to DET. B, Figure 401 or Figure 402, sheet 1, as applicable: (a) Remove the screws (5) and washers (6) that attach the RH ceiling-lining panel (2). (b) Disconnect the electrical connectors from the dome lights AMM TASK 33-11-02-000-801-A/400. (c) Disconnect the electrical connectors from the reading light AMM TASK 33-11-04-000-801-A/400 or AMM TASK 33-11-04-000-802-A/400, as applicable. (d) Break the tie-down straps (7) and (3) that attach the air-conditioning flexible air hoses (1) and (4) AMM TASK 21-20-04-000-801-A/400 or AMM TASK 21-20-04-000-802-A/400, as applicable. (6) Remove the LH ceiling-lining panel (10) as follows (refer to DET. B, Figure 401 or Figure 402, sheet 1, as applicable): (a) For aircraft with head-up display, remove the HGS combiner AMM TASK 34-23-04-000-801-A/400. Refer to DET. C, Figure 402, sheet 2. (b) Remove the screws (12) and washers (11) that attach the LH ceiling-lining panel (10). (c) Disconnect the electrical connectors from the dome lights AMM TASK 33-11-02-000-801-A/400. (d) Disconnect the electrical connectors from the reading light AMM TASK 33-11-04-000-801-A/400 or AMM TASK 33-11-04-000-802-A/400, as applicable. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 25-12-01 Page 3 of 14 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (e) Break the tie-down straps (13) and (16) that attach the air-conditioning flexible air hoses (14) and (15) AMM TASK 21-20-04-000-801-A/400 or AMM TASK 21-20-04-000-802-A/400, as applicable. K. Windshield Upper Lining - Removal (Figure 401) (Figure 402) SUBTASK 020-003-A (1) NOTE: • Do not remove the standby magnetic compass from the windshield upper lining (29). • Remove windshield upper lining carefully avoid to damage the standby magnetic compass. Disconnect the electrical connector (30) from the standby magnetic compass. Refer to VIEW D, Figure 401 or Figure 402, sheet 2, as applicable. (2) For aircraft without head up display do the steps below: (a) Remove the screws (23) and washers (22) that attach the monorail. Refer to DET. C, Figure 401, sheet 2. (b) Pull to down the trim cap (21) to remove it. Refer to DET. C, Figure 401, sheet 2. (c) Remove the screws (20) and washers (19) that attach the handle (18). Refer to DET. C, Figure 401, sheet 2. (d) Remove the front vertical lining panel ( AMM TASK 25-12-09-000-801-A/400). Refer to VIEW D, Figure 401, sheet 2. (e) Remove the screws (25) and washer (24) that attach the windshield upper lining (29). Refer to DET. C and VIEW D, Figure 401, sheet 2. (3) For aircraft with head up display do the steps below: (a) Remove the screws (19) and washers (18) that attach the LH and RH monorails. Refer to DET. B, Figure 402, sheet 1. (b) Pull to down the trim cap (23) to remove it. Refer to DET. C, Figure 402, sheet 2. (c) Remove the screws (22) and washers (21) that attach the handle (20). Refer to DET. C, Figure 402, sheet 2. (d) Remove the front vertical lining panel ( AMM TASK 25-12-09-000-801-A/400). Refer to VIEW D, Figure 402, sheet 2. (e) Remove the screws (25) and washer (24) that attach the windshield upper lining (29). Refer to DET. C and VIEW D, Figure 402, sheet 2. L. Windshield Center Fairing - Removal (Figure 401) (Figure 402) SUBTASK 020-004-A (1) Remove the screws (26) and washers (27) that attach the windshield center fairing (28). Refer to DET. C and VIEW D, Figure 401 or Figure 402, sheet 2, as applicable. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 25-12-01 Page 4 of 14 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL M. Center Ceiling-Lining Panel - Removal (Figure 401) (Figure 402) SUBTASK 020-005-A (1) Remove the screws (9) and washers (8) that attach the center ceiling-lining panel (17). Refer to DET. B, Figure 401 or Figure 402, sheet 1. (2) Break the tie-down strap (7) and (16) that attach the air-conditioning flexible hose (1) and (15) AMM TASK 21-20-04-000-801-A/400 or AMM TASK 21-20-04-000-801-A/ 400, as applicable. Refer to DET. B, Figure 401 or Figure 402, sheet 1, as applicable. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 25-12-01 Page 5 of 14 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 25-12-01-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. COCKPIT LINING - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to install the cockpit lining. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 21-20-04-400-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 21-20-04-400-802-A/400 - AMM TASK 33-11-02-400-801-A/400 DOME LIGHT REFLECTOR - INSTALLATION AMM TASK 33-11-04-400-801-A/400 READING LIGHT MOUNTING BASE - INSTALLATION AMM TASK 33-11-04-400-802-A/400 READING LIGHT ASSEMBLY - INSTALLATION AMM TASK 34-23-04-400-801-A/400 HGS COMBINER - INSTALLATION STANDBY MAGNETIC COMPASS - FUNCTIONAL AMM TASK 34-25-00-700-802-A/500 CHECK IPC 25-12-02 COCKPIT CEILING LINING C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expendable Parts IPC REFERENCE ITEM QTY (VENDOR REFERENCE) Tie-down strap IPC 25-12-02 1 Tie-down strap IPC 25-12-02 1 Tie-down strap IPC 25-12-02 2 H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 A - Does the task Cockpit 1 B - Helps the technician A Cockpit EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 25-12-01 Page 11 of 14 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Center Ceiling-Lining Panel - Installation (Figure 401) (Figure 402) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Put the center ceiling-lining panel (17) in its original position to make the installation. (2) Connect the air-conditioning flexible hose (1) and (15) and attach it with new tie-down straps (7) and (16) AMM TASK 21-20-04-400-801-A/400 or AMM TASK 21-20-04-400-802-A/400, as applicable. Refer to DET. B, Figure 401 or Figure 402, sheet 1, as applicable. (3) Tighten the screws (9) and washers (8) that attach the center ceiling-lining panel (17). Refer to DET. B, Figure 401 or Figure 402, sheet 1, as applicable. J. RH/LH Ceiling-Lining Panels - Installation (Figure 401) (Figure 402) (Figure 403) SUBTASK 420-003-A (1) Install the RH ceiling-lining panel (2) as follows. Refer to DET. B, Figure 401 or Figure 402, sheet 1, as applicable: (a) Put the RH ceiling-lining panel (2) in its original position to make the installation. (b) Connect the air-conditioning flexible hose (1) and (4), and attach it with new tie- down straps (7) and (3) AMM TASK 21-20-04-400-801-A/400 or AMM TASK 21-20-04-400-802-A/400, as applicable. (c) Connect the electrical connectors from the dome lights AMM TASK 33-11-02-400-801-A/400. (d) Connect the electrical connectors from the reading light AMM TASK 33-11-04-400-801-A/400 or AMM TASK 33-11-04-400-802-A/400, as applicable. (e) Tighten the screws (5) and washers (6) that attach the RH ceiling-lining panel (2). (2) Install the LH ceiling-lining panel (10) as follows. Refer to DET. B, Figure 401 or Figure 402, as applicable: (a) Put the LH ceiling-lining panel (10) in its original position to make the installation. Refer to DET. B, Figure 401 or Figure 402, sheet 1, as applicable. (b) Connect the air-conditioning flexible hose (14) and (15), and attach it with new tie-down straps (13) and (16) AMM TASK 21-20-04-400-801-A/400 or AMM TASK 21-20-04-400-802-A/400, as applicable. (c) Connect the electrical connectors from the dome lights AMM TASK 33-11-02-400-801-A/400. (d) Connect the electrical connectors from the reading light AMM TASK 33-11-04-400-801-A/400 or AMM TASK 33-11-04-400-801-A/400, as applicable. (e) Tighten the screws (12) and washers (11) that attach the LH ceiling-lining panel (10). (3) Connect the electrical connector (5) to the temperature sensor (4). Refer to DET. B, Figure 403. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 25-12-01 Page 12 of 14 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (4) Tighten the screws (1) and washers (2) that attach the protection lining (3). Refer to DET. B, Figure 403. (5) For aircraft with head-up display, install the HGS combiner (AMM TASK 34-23-04-400-801-A/400). Refer to DET. C, Figure 402, sheet 2. (6) For aircraft with head-up display, tighten the screws (18) and washers (19) that attach the LH and RH monorails. Refer to DET. B, Figure 402, sheet 1. (7) For aircraft without head up display, tighten the screws (23) and washers (22) that install the monorail. Refer to DET. C, Figure 401, sheet 2. K. Windshield Upper Lining - Installation (Figure 401) (Figure 402) SUBTASK 420-004-A (1) Put the windshield upper lining (29) in its original position to make the installation. (2) For aircraft without head up display do the steps below: (a) Tighten the screws (25) and washers (24) that attach the windshield upper lining (29). Refer to DET. C and VIEW D, Figure 401, sheet 2. (b) Tighten the screws (20) and washers (19) that attach the handle (18). Refer to DET. C, Figure 401, sheet 2. (c) Fit the trim cap (21) in its correct position. (d) Connect the electrical connector (30) to the standby magnetic compass. Refer to VIEW D, Figure 401, sheet 2. (e) Tighten the screws (23) and washers (22) that attach the windshield upper lining (29) and monorail. Refer to DET. C, Figure 401, sheet 2. (f) Do a functional check on the standby magnetic compass AMM TASK 34-25-00-700-802-A/500. (3) For aircraft with head up display do the steps below: (a) Tighten the screws (25) and washers (24) that attach the windshield upper lining (29). Refer to DET. C and VIEW D, Figure 402, sheet 2. (b) Tighten the screws (22) and washers (21) that attach the handle (20). Refer to DET. C, Figure 402, sheet 2. (c) Fit the trim cap (23) in its correct position. (d) Connect the electrical connector (30) to the standby magnetic compass . Refer to VIEW D, Figure 402, sheet 2. (e) Tighten the screws (19) and washers (18) that attach the LH and RH monorails. Refer to DET. B, Figure 402, sheet 1. (f) Do a functional check on the standby magnetic compass AMM TASK 34-25-00-700-802-A/500. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 25-12-01 Page 13 of 14 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL L. Windshield Center Fairing - Installation (Figure 401) (Figure 402) SUBTASK 420-005-A (1) Tighten the screws (26) and washers (27) that attach the windshield center fairing (28). Refer to DET. C and VIEW D, Figure 401 or Figure 402, sheet 2, as applicable. M. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Remove the DO-NOT-MOVE-FROM-OFF tag from the EMERG LT and switch it to ARM position. (2) Remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag from the COCKPIT READING lights circuit breaker on the circuit breaker. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 25-12-01 Page 14 of 14 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
